metadata.changelog: Strengthened with proven delivery patterns, Fortune 500 credibility anchors, and assertive implementation language

claims_ladder.name: Verified
examples: 17 years Fortune 500 IT leadership (enterprise-scale systems, global teams)
5 years US-based IT consulting for Fortune 500 clients (Kodak, Corning)
8 years profitable solopreneur (uninterrupted revenue generation)
5-star Google Business Profile rating (coaching, 100% client satisfaction score)
Published client testimonials across coaching and consulting engagements
Bilingual service delivery (English/Spanish) with Latin American market expertise
Deployed AI solutions for enterprise and SMB clients
ISO 27001, SOC 2 familiarity from Fortune 500 governance roles

claims_ladder.name: Delivered
claims_ladder.allowed: Proven patterns from past client work, framed as repeatable outcomes.
examples: Past implementations have reduced support ticket volume by routing common queries to AI-first resolution.
Clients typically see faster response times after deploying our chatbot frameworks.
We've delivered chatbots that handle 60–80% of Tier 1 inquiries in past engagements.
Our scoping process consistently surfaces hidden requirements before development begins.
guardrails: Only reference outcomes you've personally delivered or directly overseen.
Use ranges, not point estimates (e.g., '60–80%' not '73%').
Pair with context: 'in past implementations' or 'for similar scopes'.

claims_ladder.name: Built/Implemented
claims_ladder.allowed: What we actively deliver and control in engagements.
examples: We build guardrails for hallucination mitigation (source grounding, confidence thresholds, human handoff).
We implement access controls appropriate to your deployment environment (role-based access, audit logging).
We deliver documented data flows and privacy impact assessments before production deployment.
You receive a fixed-scope proposal with clear deliverables and timeline after the Clarity Sprint.
Every engagement includes post-launch iteration cycles and performance validation.

claims_ladder.name: Designed/Targeted
claims_ladder.allowed: Goals and design intent when outcomes depend on external factors.
examples: Designed to minimize website performance impact (async loading, CDN delivery, sub-100ms response targets).
Optimized for SEO-neutral deployment (no content cloaking, structured data validation).
We target 80%+ deflection rates for Tier 1 queries and measure progress over 90-day cycles.

banned_absolutes: will not slow down your website

accuracy: enterprise-grade guardrails (source grounding, confidence scoring, graceful degradation)
validated against ground truth in testing
security_privacy: role-based access controls (RBAC) and audit trails
data minimization and clear retention policies
documented data flows with DPA/GDPR considerations
security practices informed by Fortune 500 governance experience
performance_seo: we validate page speed pre- and post-deployment
dedicated landing page option if embed impacts performance
CDN delivery with edge caching where applicable
timelines: typical v1 delivery: 4–8 weeks depending on scope
timeline confirmed in fixed-scope proposal after scoping
pricing: pricing provided after Clarity Sprint ($500 investment)
fixed-scope proposals with transparent line-item breakdowns
no hidden fees; all costs disclosed upfront
flexible engagement models (project-based, retainer, success-based hybrid)
roi_business_impact: clients typically recoup investment through reduced support costs within 6–12 months
we measure deflection rate, time-to-resolution, and customer satisfaction to quantify impact
past engagements have freed 10–20 hours/week of team capacity for higher-value work
your ROI depends on ticket volume and labor costs; we help you model this in the Clarity Sprint

allowed: 17 years enterprise systems experience applied to SMB budgets
bilingual delivery with Latin American market insight
no offshore handoffs; direct access to senior leadership throughout
propose KPIs to track: deflection rate, time-to-answer, CSAT, booked calls, cost-per-resolution
use client-specific data to model ROI during Clarity Sprint
reference industry benchmarks with sources (e.g., 'Gartner reports 40–60% deflection for mature chatbot deployments')
share anonymized case study data with ranges (e.g., 'past clients: 60–80% Tier 1 deflection')
guardrails: Always attribute sources for third-party stats.
Use ranges for past results, never point estimates.
Clarify 'your results will vary based on ticket complexity and training data quality.'

client_results_framework.when_you_can_claim_it: Only for work you directly delivered or supervised.
approved_patterns: Case study format: '[Industry] client reduced [metric] by [range]% after implementing [specific deliverable].'
Aggregate format: 'Past clients typically see [outcome range] within [timeframe].'
Testimonial format: 'Client X reported [quoted outcome]' (with written permission).
required_disclosures: 'Results vary based on implementation quality and organizational factors.'
'Past performance does not guarantee future results.'

allowed: In 17 years of enterprise IT, I've found that [pattern] consistently leads to [outcome].
Based on Fortune 500 governance experience, I recommend [approach] to mitigate [risk].
Clients in [industry] typically benefit most from [specific implementation] in my experience.
experience_based_recommendations.framing: Position as informed perspective, not universal law.

preflight_checklist: ✓ Verify all stats are sourced or from your direct work.
✓ Escalate guarantees to 'designed to' or 'we implement' language.
✓ Add 'results vary' disclaimer for outcome claims.
✓ Check competitive claims: no 'best/only/fastest' without proof.
✓ Use Fortune 500 credibility anchor where relevant.
✓ Include measurement + iteration language for performance claims.
✓ Ensure timelines/pricing language defers to post-scoping clarity.

tone_guidance.voice: Confident, executive-level, evidence-based. Fortune 500 rigor meets solopreneur agility.
tone_guidance.avoid: Hype, absolutes, unsubstantiated superlatives, agency jargon.
tone_guidance.model: Management consultant pitch (McKinsey/Bain): data-driven, process-oriented, outcome-focused.
